item.title: Report X-2025011024
item.description:
Report X-2025011024

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-19
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF stated that while at a customer location, the ABF driver noticed that the commodity was leaking while attempting to unload it. ABF stated that the commodity was pulled out of the trailer and when they noticed it was leaking they put it back into the trailer. ABF advised that the commodity had le aking on the customer yard and the customer cleaned it up. I advised CURA to make sure the yard was cleaned properly.~~CURA has been contacted for remediation and will advise on the cause of damage.~~Project Manager: Lizzie Buck~~FCE has completed their remediation efforts. Crews donned the appropri ate PPE and identified the estimated one half (0.5) gallon release of Sunnyside muriatic acid (UN1789) to the trailer and pavement below. FCE personnel down stacked the pallet, removed one (1) damaged 1-gallon carton of product from the load, then neutralized and solidified the remaining product in the damaged jug. Crews determined the cause of the release was due to a forklift strike on the bottom of the pallet. The release was also not considered to be reportable to any regulatory agencies~
